comments.html:
Small detail: IOS 15.1(1)XB versus 15.1(1)T

15.1(1)XB is a fork without 6VPE and some other features, but with LISP support. Hopefully they will consolidate that in the near future by putting LISP in the T train.
comments.name: Job Snijders

comments.html: Ah, the X-files are always special  8-)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Well that actually begs the next interesting question.  Where do the -X and other branch releases fit into this new naming scheme?  Would there ever be a say, 15.1(3)XD and would it be a branch off the 15.1(3)T or a fork off the 15.1(3) mainline?
comments.name: Reuben Farrelly

comments.html: I can try to guess this one: there's no 15.1(3) mainline (see the description in the blog post). There will be 15.1(x)M, after which there will be no more 15.1(x+1)T releases. One would thus expect the X-files to be a branch off a T release.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
